lead_paragraph: A new book brings attention to the deadly 1971 prison uprising. Reporters for The New York Times and The Marshall Project describe what has changed since then, and what hasn’t.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP, TOM ROBBINS and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

headline.print_headline: Revisiting Attica Shows Ways  State Failed to Fulfill Promises
headline.main: Revisiting Attica Shows How New York State Failed to Fulfill Promises

snippet: A new book brings attention to the deadly 1971 prison uprising. Reporters for The New York Times and The Marshall Project describe what has changed since then, and what hasn’t....
abstract: Following uprising at Attica Correctional Facility in 1971, some landmark prison reforms were implemented in New York State, but many promises made following riots were never implemented or were rolled back under political pressure; some reforms promised in 1971 highlighted along with their current status.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Blood in the Water: The Attica Prison Uprising of 1971 and Its Legacy (Book)
